author: NASS
description:
I colorized, restored, and created the sound design for this footage filmed around New York City and Coney Island. It features iconic locations including Lower and Central Manhattan, Brooklyn, the Woolworth Building, the MetLife Tower, and scenes from Coney Island and more


Video Restoration Process:
✔ FPS boosted to 60 frames per second 
✔ Image resolution boosted up to HD 
✔ Improved video sharpness and brightness 
✔ Colorized only for the ambiance (not historically accurate)
✔added sound design only for the ambiance
✔restoration:(stabilisation,denoise,cleand,deblur,deflicker) 

Please, be aware that colorization colors are not real and fake, colorization was made only for the ambiance and do not represent real historical data.

Michael Rogge (27 May 1929 – 26 January 2024), also known as IJsbrand Rogge or Ysbrand Rogge was a Dutch photographer, videographer and amateur filmmaker, best known for his depictions of post-WW2 life in the Far East, in particular, Hong Kong and Japan. (
title: 1920s - New York & Coney Island in color [60fps,Remastered] w/sound design added
